content:
Functional Capacity and Quality of Life
Functional capacity was measured as distance on the 6-minute walk test. In the group that underwent pulmonary-vein isolation, the distance increased from 269±54 m at baseline to 340±49 m at 6 months, as compared with 281±44 m to 297±36 m at 6 months in the group that underwent atrioventricular-node ablation with biventricular pacing (P<0.001) (Figure 3B).
query: exercise tolerance functional capacity amiodarone beta-blockers atrial fibrillation physical activity six minute walk
title: Pulmonary-vein isolation for atrial fibrillation in patients with heart failure
authors: Mohammed N. Khan, Pierre Jaïs, Jennifer Cummings, Luigi Di Biase, Prashanthan Sanders, David O. Starling, Antonio Dello Russo, Gemma Pelargonio, Johannes Brachmann, Volker Schibgilla, Aldo Bonso, Michela Casella, Antonio Raviele, Michel Haïssaguerre, Andrea Natale
